55 
56 ComputeIK::ComputeIK(const std::string& name, Stage::pointer&& child) : WrapperBase(name, std::move(child)) {
57  auto& p = properties();
58  p.declare<std::string>("eef", "name of end-effector group");
59  p.declare<std::string>("group", "name of active group (derived from eef if not provided)");
60  p.declare<std::string>("default_pose", "", "default joint pose of active group (defines cost of IK)");
61  p.declare<uint32_t>("max_ik_solutions", 1);
62  p.declare<bool>("ignore_collisions", false);
63  p.declare<double>("min_solution_distance", 0.1,
64  "minimum distance between seperate IK solutions for the same target");
65 
66  // ik_frame and target_pose are read from the interface
67  p.declare<geometry_msgs::PoseStamped>("ik_frame", "frame to be moved towards goal pose");
68  p.declare<geometry_msgs::PoseStamped>("target_pose", "goal pose for ik frame");
69 }
70 
71 void ComputeIK::setIKFrame(const Eigen::Isometry3d& pose, const std::string& link) {
72  geometry_msgs::PoseStamped pose_msg;
73  pose_msg.header.frame_id = link;
74  tf::poseEigenToMsg(pose, pose_msg.pose);
75  setIKFrame(pose_msg);
76 }
77 
78 void ComputeIK::setTargetPose(const Eigen::Isometry3d& pose, const std::string& frame) {
79  geometry_msgs::PoseStamped pose_msg;
80  pose_msg.header.frame_id = frame;
81  tf::poseEigenToMsg(pose, pose_msg.pose);
82  setTargetPose(pose_msg);
83 }

85 // found IK solutions with a flag indicating validity
86 typedef std::vector<std::vector<double>> IKSolutions;

88 namespace {
89 
90 // ??? TODO: provide callback methods in PlanningScene class / probably not very useful here though...
91 // TODO: move into MoveIt! core, lift active_components_only_ from fcl to common interface
92 bool isTargetPoseColliding(const planning_scene::PlanningScenePtr& scene, Eigen::Isometry3d pose,
93  const robot_model::LinkModel* link,
94  collision_detection::CollisionResult* collision_result = nullptr) {
95  robot_state::RobotState& robot_state = scene->getCurrentStateNonConst();
96 
97  // consider all rigidly connected parent links as well
98  const robot_model::LinkModel* parent = robot_model::RobotModel::getRigidlyConnectedParentLinkModel(link);
99  if (parent != link) // transform pose into pose suitable to place parent
100  pose = pose * robot_state.getGlobalLinkTransform(link).inverse() * robot_state.getGlobalLinkTransform(parent);
101 
102  // place link at given pose
103  robot_state.updateStateWithLinkAt(parent, pose);
104  robot_state.updateCollisionBodyTransforms();
105 
106  // disable collision checking for parent links (except links fixed to root)
107  auto& acm = scene->getAllowedCollisionMatrixNonConst();
108  std::vector<const std::string*> pending_links; // parent link names that might be rigidly connected to root
109  while (parent) {
110  pending_links.push_back(&parent->getName());
111  link = parent;
112  const robot_model::JointModel* joint = link->getParentJointModel();
113  parent = joint->getParentLinkModel();
114 
115  if (joint->getType() != robot_model::JointModel::FIXED) {
116  for (const std::string* name : pending_links)
117  acm.setDefaultEntry(*name, true);
118  pending_links.clear();
119  }
120  }
121 
122  // check collision with the world using the padded version
123  collision_detection::CollisionRequest req;
124  collision_detection::CollisionResult result;
125  req.contacts = (collision_result != nullptr);
126  collision_detection::CollisionResult& res = collision_result ? *collision_result : result;
127  scene->checkCollision(req, res, robot_state, acm);
128  return res.collision;
129 }
130 
131 std::string listCollisionPairs(const collision_detection::CollisionResult::ContactMap& contacts,
132  const std::string& separator) {
133  std::string result;
134  for (const auto& contact : contacts) {
135  if (!result.empty())
136  result.append(separator);
137  result.append(contact.first.first).append(" - ").append(contact.first.second);
138  }
139  return result;
140 }
141 
142 bool validateEEF(const PropertyMap& props, const moveit::core::RobotModelConstPtr& robot_model,
143  const moveit::core::JointModelGroup*& jmg, std::string* msg) {
144  try {
145  const std::string& eef = props.get<std::string>("eef");
146  if (!robot_model->hasEndEffector(eef)) {
147  if (msg)
148  *msg = "Unknown end effector: " + eef;
149  return false;
150  } else
151  jmg = robot_model->getEndEffector(eef);
152  } catch (const Property::undefined&) {
153  }
154  return true;
155 }
156 bool validateGroup(const PropertyMap& props, const moveit::core::RobotModelConstPtr& robot_model,
157  const moveit::core::JointModelGroup* eef_jmg, const moveit::core::JointModelGroup*& jmg,
158  std::string* msg) {
159  try {
160  const std::string& group = props.get<std::string>("group");
161  if (!(jmg = robot_model->getJointModelGroup(group))) {
162  if (msg)
163  *msg = "Unknown group: " + group;
164  return false;
165  }
166  } catch (const Property::undefined&) {
167  if (eef_jmg) {
168  // derive group from eef
169  const auto& parent = eef_jmg->getEndEffectorParentGroup();
170  jmg = robot_model->getJointModelGroup(parent.first);
171  }
172  }
173  return true;
174 }
175 
176 } // anonymous namespace
177 
178 void ComputeIK::reset() {
179  upstream_solutions_.clear();
180  WrapperBase::reset();
181 }
182 
183 void ComputeIK::init(const moveit::core::RobotModelConstPtr& robot_model) {
184  InitStageException errors;
185  try {
186  WrapperBase::init(robot_model);
187  } catch (InitStageException& e) {
188  errors.append(e);
189  }
190 
191  // all properties can be derived from the interface state
192  // however, if they are defined already now, we validate here
193  const auto& props = properties();
194  const moveit::core::JointModelGroup* eef_jmg = nullptr;
195  const moveit::core::JointModelGroup* jmg = nullptr;
196  std::string msg;
197 
198  if (!validateEEF(props, robot_model, eef_jmg, &msg))
199  errors.push_back(*this, msg);
200  if (!validateGroup(props, robot_model, eef_jmg, jmg, &msg))
201  errors.push_back(*this, msg);
202 
203  if (errors)
204  throw errors;
205 }
206 
207 void ComputeIK::onNewSolution(const SolutionBase& s) {
208  assert(s.start() && s.end());
209  assert(s.start()->scene() == s.end()->scene()); // wrapped child should be a generator
210 
211  // It's safe to store a pointer to the solution, as the generating stage stores it
212  upstream_solutions_.push(&s);
213 }
214 
215 bool ComputeIK::canCompute() const {
216  return !upstream_solutions_.empty() || WrapperBase::canCompute();
217 }
218 
219 void ComputeIK::compute() {
220  if (WrapperBase::canCompute())
221  WrapperBase::compute();
222 
223  if (upstream_solutions_.empty())
224  return;
225 
226  const SolutionBase& s = *upstream_solutions_.pop();
227 
228  // -1 TODO: this should not be necessary in my opinion: Why do you think so?
229  // It is, because the properties on the interface might change from call to call...
230  // enforced initialization from interface ensures that new target_pose is read
231  properties().performInitFrom(INTERFACE, s.start()->properties());
232  const auto& props = properties();
233 
234  planning_scene::PlanningScenePtr sandbox_scene = s.start()->scene()->diff();
235 
236  const bool ignore_collisions = props.get<bool>("ignore_collisions");
237  const auto& robot_model = sandbox_scene->getRobotModel();
238  const moveit::core::JointModelGroup* eef_jmg = nullptr;
239  const moveit::core::JointModelGroup* jmg = nullptr;
240  std::string msg;
241 
242  if (!validateEEF(props, robot_model, eef_jmg, &msg)) {
243  ROS_WARN_STREAM_NAMED("ComputeIK", msg);
244  return;
245  }
246  if (!validateGroup(props, robot_model, eef_jmg, jmg, &msg)) {
247  ROS_WARN_STREAM_NAMED("ComputeIK", msg);
248  return;
249  }
250  if (!eef_jmg && !jmg) {
251  ROS_WARN_STREAM_NAMED("ComputeIK", "Neither eef nor group are well defined");
252  return;
253  }
254  properties().property("timeout").setDefaultValue(jmg->getDefaultIKTimeout());
255 
256  // extract target_pose
257  geometry_msgs::PoseStamped target_pose_msg = props.get<geometry_msgs::PoseStamped>("target_pose");
258  if (target_pose_msg.header.frame_id.empty()) // if not provided, assume planning frame
259  target_pose_msg.header.frame_id = sandbox_scene->getPlanningFrame();
260 
261  Eigen::Isometry3d target_pose;
262  tf::poseMsgToEigen(target_pose_msg.pose, target_pose);
263  if (target_pose_msg.header.frame_id != sandbox_scene->getPlanningFrame()) {
264  if (!sandbox_scene->knowsFrameTransform(target_pose_msg.header.frame_id)) {
265  ROS_WARN_STREAM_NAMED("ComputeIK",
266  "Unknown reference frame for target pose: " << target_pose_msg.header.frame_id);
267  return;
268  }
269  // transform target_pose w.r.t. planning frame
270  target_pose = sandbox_scene->getFrameTransform(target_pose_msg.header.frame_id) * target_pose;
271  }
272 
273  // determine IK link from ik_frame
274  const robot_model::LinkModel* link = nullptr;
275  geometry_msgs::PoseStamped ik_pose_msg;
276  const boost::any& value = props.get("ik_frame");
277  if (value.empty()) { // property undefined
278  // determine IK link from eef/group
279  if (!(link = eef_jmg ? robot_model->getLinkModel(eef_jmg->getEndEffectorParentGroup().second) :
280  jmg->getOnlyOneEndEffectorTip())) {
281  ROS_WARN_STREAM_NAMED("ComputeIK", "Failed to derive IK target link");
282  return;
283  }
284  ik_pose_msg.header.frame_id = link->getName();
285  ik_pose_msg.pose.orientation.w = 1.0;
286  } else {
287  ik_pose_msg = boost::any_cast<geometry_msgs::PoseStamped>(value);
288  Eigen::Isometry3d ik_pose;
289  tf::poseMsgToEigen(ik_pose_msg.pose, ik_pose);
290  if (robot_model->hasLinkModel(ik_pose_msg.header.frame_id)) {
291  link = robot_model->getLinkModel(ik_pose_msg.header.frame_id);
292  } else {
293  const robot_state::AttachedBody* attached =
294  sandbox_scene->getCurrentState().getAttachedBody(ik_pose_msg.header.frame_id);
295  if (!attached) {
296  ROS_WARN_STREAM_NAMED("ComputeIK", "Unknown frame: " << ik_pose_msg.header.frame_id);
297  return;
298  }
299  const EigenSTL::vector_Isometry3d& tf = attached->getFixedTransforms();
300  if (tf.empty()) {
301  ROS_WARN_STREAM_NAMED("ComputeIK", "Attached body doesn't have shapes.");
302  return;
303  }
304  // prepend link
305  link = attached->getAttachedLink();
306  ik_pose = tf[0] * ik_pose;
307  }
308  // transform target pose such that ik frame will reach there if link does
309  target_pose = target_pose * ik_pose.inverse();
310  }
311 
312  // validate placed link for collisions
313  collision_detection::CollisionResult collisions;
314  bool colliding = !ignore_collisions && isTargetPoseColliding(sandbox_scene, target_pose, link, &collisions);
315 
316  robot_state::RobotState& sandbox_state = sandbox_scene->getCurrentStateNonConst();
317 
318  // markers used for failures
319  std::deque<visualization_msgs::Marker> failure_markers;
320  // frames at target pose and ik frame
321  rviz_marker_tools::appendFrame(failure_markers, target_pose_msg, 0.1, "ik frame");
322  rviz_marker_tools::appendFrame(failure_markers, ik_pose_msg, 0.1, "ik frame");
323  // visualize placed end-effector
324  auto appender = [&failure_markers](visualization_msgs::Marker& marker, const std::string& name) {
325  marker.ns = "ik target";
326  marker.color.a *= 0.5;
327  failure_markers.push_back(marker);
328  };
329  const auto& links_to_visualize = moveit::core::RobotModel::getRigidlyConnectedParentLinkModel(link)
330  ->getParentJointModel()
331  ->getDescendantLinkModels();
332  if (colliding) {
333  SubTrajectory solution;
334  generateCollisionMarkers(sandbox_state, appender, links_to_visualize);
335  std::copy(failure_markers.begin(), failure_markers.end(), std::back_inserter(solution.markers()));
336  solution.markAsFailure();
337  // TODO: visualize collisions
338  solution.setComment(s.comment() + " eef in collision: " + listCollisionPairs(collisions.contacts, ", "));
339  spawn(InterfaceState(sandbox_scene), std::move(solution));
340  return;
341  } else
342  generateVisualMarkers(sandbox_state, appender, links_to_visualize);
343 
344  // determine joint values of robot pose to compare IK solution with for costs
345  std::vector<double> compare_pose;
346  const std::string& compare_pose_name = props.get<std::string>("default_pose");
347  if (!compare_pose_name.empty()) {
348  robot_state::RobotState compare_state(robot_model);
349  compare_state.setToDefaultValues(jmg, compare_pose_name);
350  compare_state.copyJointGroupPositions(jmg, compare_pose);
351  } else
352  sandbox_scene->getCurrentState().copyJointGroupPositions(jmg, compare_pose);
353 
354  double min_solution_distance = props.get<double>("min_solution_distance");
355 
356  IKSolutions ik_solutions;
357  auto is_valid = [sandbox_scene, ignore_collisions, min_solution_distance, &ik_solutions](
358  robot_state::RobotState* state, const robot_model::JointModelGroup* jmg, const double* joint_positions) {
359  for (const auto& sol : ik_solutions) {
360  if (jmg->distance(joint_positions, sol.data()) < min_solution_distance)
361  return false; // too close to already found solution
362  }
363  state->setJointGroupPositions(jmg, joint_positions);
364  ik_solutions.emplace_back();
365  state->copyJointGroupPositions(jmg, ik_solutions.back());
366 
367  return ignore_collisions || !sandbox_scene->isStateColliding(*state, jmg->getName());
368  };
369 
370  uint32_t max_ik_solutions = props.get<uint32_t>("max_ik_solutions");
371  bool tried_current_state_as_seed = false;
372 
373  double remaining_time = timeout();
374  auto start_time = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
375  while (ik_solutions.size() < max_ik_solutions && remaining_time > 0) {
376  if (tried_current_state_as_seed)
377  sandbox_state.setToRandomPositions(jmg);
378  tried_current_state_as_seed = true;
379 
380  size_t previous = ik_solutions.size();
381  bool succeeded = sandbox_state.setFromIK(jmg, target_pose, link->getName(), remaining_time, is_valid);
382 
383  auto now = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
384  remaining_time -= std::chrono::duration<double>(now - start_time).count();
385  start_time = now;
386 
387  // for all new solutions (successes and failures)
388  for (size_t i = previous; i != ik_solutions.size(); ++i) {
389  // create a new scene for each solution as they will have different robot states
390  planning_scene::PlanningScenePtr scene = s.start()->scene()->diff();
391  SubTrajectory solution;
392  solution.setComment(s.comment());
393 
394  // frames at target pose and ik frame
395  rviz_marker_tools::appendFrame(solution.markers(), target_pose_msg, 0.1, "ik frame");
396  rviz_marker_tools::appendFrame(solution.markers(), ik_pose_msg, 0.1, "ik frame");
397 
398  if (succeeded && i + 1 == ik_solutions.size())
399  // compute cost as distance to compare_pose
400  solution.setCost(s.cost() + jmg->distance(ik_solutions.back().data(), compare_pose.data()));
401  else // found an IK solution, but this was not valid
402  solution.markAsFailure();
403 
404  // set scene's robot state
405  robot_state::RobotState& robot_state = scene->getCurrentStateNonConst();
406  robot_state.setJointGroupPositions(jmg, ik_solutions.back().data());
407  robot_state.update();
408 
409  InterfaceState state(scene);
410  forwardProperties(*s.start(), state);
411  spawn(std::move(state), std::move(solution));
412  }
413 
414  // TODO: magic constant should be a property instead ("current_seed_only", or equivalent)
415  // Yeah, you are right, these are two different semantic concepts:
416  // One could also have multiple IK solutions derived from the same seed
417  if (!succeeded && max_ik_solutions == 1)
418  break; // first and only attempt failed
419  }
420 
421  if (ik_solutions.empty()) { // failed to find any solution
422  planning_scene::PlanningScenePtr scene = s.start()->scene()->diff();
423  SubTrajectory solution;
424 
425  solution.markAsFailure();
426  solution.setComment(s.comment() + " no IK found");
427 
428  // ik target link placement
429  std::copy(failure_markers.begin(), failure_markers.end(), std::back_inserter(solution.markers()));
430 
431  spawn(InterfaceState(scene), std::move(solution));
432  }
433 }
434 } // namespace stages

moveit::task_constructor::generateVisualMarkers
